constitutionalAuthorityStatementText:
[Congressional Record Volume 168, Number 101 (Tuesday, June 14, 2022)]
[House]
From the Congressional Record Online through the Government Publishing Office [www.gpo.gov]
By Mr. YARMUTH:
H.R. 8066.
Congress has the power to enact this legislation pursuant
to the following:
Article I, Section 8, clause l; Article I, Section 8,
clause 18; and Article I, Section 9, clause 7 of the United
States Constitution.
[Page H5547]

latestAction.text: Referred to the House Committee on the Budget.

title: To make technical changes clarifying section 502 of the Federal Credit Reform Act of 1990.
